alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 1:50AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Brown and northeastern Coleman Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 150 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Thrifty, or near Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, Early, Bangs, Blanket, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Burkett, May, Cross Cut, Lake Brownwood, Zephyr, Byrds, Grosvenor, Lake Brownwood State Park, Camp Bowie, Owens and Thrifty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
